newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australia's Colston urges expenses scrutiny.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australia's Colston urges expenses scrutiny.

text.p: Australian independent Senator Mal Colston said on Monday that all upper house members of parliament should have their travel allowances checked.
Colston, a key Senate independent, has been accused of fraud, which he denies. If charged and convicted, he would be forced to leave parliament.
Colston said in a statement he would talk with Senate officials later on Monday about new allegations of travel allowance abuse raised in weekend media reports.
"Nevertheless, as my travel allowance claims have received daily scrutiny, I believe the same should apply for every other member of the Senate," Colston said in a statement.
"Therefore, this afternoon, I will give notice of motion that all travel allowance documents of all senators be tabled in the Senate," he said.

Colston, who defected from the Labor Party in August, is being examined by the Australian Federal Police over allegations he misused parliamentary allowances, gave government-paid jobs in his office to relatives who did not work and misused government car entitlements.
Colston is one of the two independents in the Senate who have routinely supplied the two votes that the Liberal-National government needs to pass contentious legislation.
Despite a massive majority in the lower house, the government is in a minority in the Senate, which has the power to block laws.
